comments.content: Which one is the Tiffany Spike?
Did you make that chart or did that come from your stats package?

Sorry I've had to cut back.   
   
BTW, I can see that "X" is probably mostly New Zealand (not Kamtchatka), but who the hell is "R"?!

Not in western Siberia.

looks like R - China? N - Moscow..
yes hrant. Portugal & UK are on the same time zone. Phew ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052848im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) Less weight then :P

Well, China is all one time zone, but:   
1) I haven't noticed many typophilers from there.   
2) It's GMT+8 which would make it "T".   
   
BTW, I think GMT might be "K" and not "L" - but that would still make China "S" not "R".   
   
hhp

FontLab Ltd. is registered in the Cayman Islands, I believe.
yes hrant. Portugal & UK are on the same time zone. Phew ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052848im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) Less weight then :P

The Russian developers for FontLab are based in St. Petersburg.   
   
T

I wonder how the stats are generated? Is it by IP address? I live in northern Virginia. We always get a HUGE spike on hits supposedly from here because both UUNET and AOL are here in Fairfax County Virginia (5 miles from me). The trouble is, there are boatloads of people from all over the USA using AOL and generating an Eastern Timezone IP even if they are from Alaska. I'll bet if you totalled all the Eastern Time hits and subtracted non-eastern AOL and UUNET IPs, you would get a much smaller number.   
   
ChrisL   
PS: Either that or us easterners spend too much time online:-)

\>\>yes hrant. Portugal & UK are on the same time zone. Phew   
   
But is Portugal on GMT?   
UK at the moment is on BST
Yes! I think X is entirely me! (or so I like to think!)

kris,   
\>Yes! I think X is entirely me! (or so I like to think!)\<   
   
I hear that there is a Tazmanian Devil down there posing as the Hrant of New Zealand but he is not only X, he is XT.   
:-)

XT mate, XT. Quick traveller. The South-Pacific typedemon!   
   
Is it just me, or does the world seem a lot smaller when you see it like this?
It gives a sense of insecurity being "between L and M" (it seems I'm more "slightly off-L", anyway). Me, Alessandro Segalini and who?

That could be me? Or? Oy, school never prepared for this.
